dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1095 IH: AR–15 National Gun Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Moore of Alabama (for himself, Mr. Clyde, Mrs. Boebert, and Mr. Santos) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Accountability

form.official-title: To declare an AR–15 style rifle chambered in a .223 Remington round or a 5.56x45mm NATO round to be the National Gun of the United States.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the AR–15 National Gun Act.
An AR–15 style rifle chambered in a .223 Remington round or a 5.56x45mm NATO round is hereby declared to be the National Gun of the United States.
